arts.ttl: Raphinha's old Leeds team-mate makes feelings clear on just what Barcelona star is capable of
arts.sum: Raphinha was Pascal Struijk's team-mate at Leeds for two seasons and says he knew from their first training session together that he was quality

arts.ttl: Leeds United transfer news as the Whites and Sheffield United 'chase' ex-Huddersfield Town man
arts.sum: When asked by MOT Leeds News if Joseph could depart this summer, former United goalkeeper Paul Robinson said: “No, I think he [Joseph] is a good player. Leeds are said to be big admirers of Montpellier defender Modibo Sagnan, according to French outlet Foot Mercato .

arts.ttl: 'Really matters' - Michael Carrick's Kelechi Iheanacho defence after Middlesbrough struggles - Teesside Live
arts.sum: Michael Carrick leapt to the defence of Kelechi Iheanacho and said support is important after the Middlesbrough striker was ironically cheered off the pitch in defeat to Leeds United. Support is the important thing for every player.

arts.ttl: Two sides to Middlesbrough's disappointment as Michael Carrick offers his Leeds loss verdict
arts.sum: Carrick said: “Obviously, we didn’t score, but to create those opportunities, I think it’s probably the most that I’ve seen Leeds be put under pressure for a long period of time. Michael Carrick said there were two sides to Middlesbrough’s disappointment, as their four-match unbeaten run came to an end at the hands of Leeds United.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick left 'bitterly disappointed' as Leeds United see off Middlesbrough threat
arts.sum: Boro rallied and had created a number of opportunities themselves but lacked quality and composure in the final third. I thought the goal was coming; we had opportunities across the box.

arts.ttl: Leeds return to summit after James’ early strike sees off Middlesbrough
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Riverside Stadium
arts.sum: A night when visiting fans had reason to lament the absence of VAR was more uncomfortable for Leeds than it should have been but still ended with Daniel Farke’s team top of the Championship. Farke was furious to see two “goals” from first Ao Tanaka and then Patrick Bamford disallowed for imaginary offsides, but his players somehow weathered a late attacking storm from Michael Carrick’s playoff-chasing Middlesbrough to move ahead of Burnley on goal difference. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Daniel James strikes early as Leeds move back to Championship summit
arts.sum: A 1-0 win over Middlesbrough saw United take advantage of their promotion rivals’ dropped points.

arts.ttl: Neil Warnock delivers scathing offside verdict as Leeds United linesman repeats major error
arts.sum: Former Leeds United manager Neil Warnock has slammed the decision to disallow Ao Tanaka's first-half goal against Middlesbrough and labelled it as a "disgrace". But Leeds' celebrations were soon cut short when the linesman put up his flag and judged Tanaka to have been offside in the build-up.

arts.ttl: Leeds United team news vs Middlesbrough as Wilfried Gnonto dropped
arts.sum: Starting XI: Darlow; Bogle, Rodon, Ampadu, Firpo; Tanaka, Gruev; James, Aaronson, Solomon; Piroe Daniel Farke has replaced Wilfried Gnonto with Brenden Aaronson at number 10 in his Leeds United line-up for tonight's clash with Middlesbrough.

arts.ttl: Team News: Middlesbrough vs. Leeds, Derby vs. Burnley, Sheffield United vs. Millwall: Tuesday's Championship team news in full
arts.sum: Sports Mole brings you Tuesday's Championship team news in full, including for Derby County vs. Burnley and Middlesbrough vs. Leeds United.
